definition: ox/cow/bull/CL:條|条[tiao2],頭|头[tou2]/newton (abbr. for 牛頓|牛顿[niu2 dun4])/(slang) awesome

sentences.english: He brought me a can of Red Bull.
Couldn't you have just had a Red Bull and a sugar cookie ?
sentences.chinese: 你爲什麼不拿瓶紅牛和餅乾來賭啊？

sentences.english: What is it about Red Bull drivers and water?
sentences.chinese: 紅牛車手和水之間有神馬不可告人的祕密？

sentences.english: Have another cup of coffee, maybe a rockstar, or redbull.
sentences.chinese: 再來一杯咖啡，或是玩一會兒遊戲還是喝瓶紅牛？

sentences.english: Austria is the home to the popular energy drink Red Bull.
sentences.chinese: 奧地利是受歡迎的功能飲料紅牛的產地。

sentences.english: Q. Did you expect it to be as decisive as this with the Red Bulls picking up just one point?
sentences.chinese: 你是否認爲這是與紅牛爭鬥中的一場決定性的勝利？

sentences.english: Ultimately that got them clear of the Toro Rossos.
sentences.chinese: 最後，這讓他們都跑在了紅牛之隊的前面。

sentences.english: RBR team boss Christian Horner said he is not in a rush to make a decision.
sentences.chinese: 紅牛車隊的老闆霍納說他並不急於作出決定。

sentences.english: First pour the Bols Blue in. Second, the Red Bull(half a can) and add seven-up.
sentences.chinese: 首先倒入波士藍橙，接着倒入紅牛，注滿七喜。

sentences.english: Last year, my choice is: Toro Rosso .
sentences.chinese: 去年我的選擇是小紅牛。

sentences.english: I am expecting the Red Bulls to be really tough and Ferrari.
sentences.chinese: 我想紅牛跟法拉利會是個麻煩。

sentences.english: First pour the Bols Blue in. Second, the Red Bull and last, add seven-up.
sentences.chinese: 首先倒入波士藍橙，接着倒入紅牛，注滿七喜。

sentences.english: Think: Red Bull. What comes to mind?
sentences.chinese: 當你想起“紅牛”時，你會想到什麼？

sentences.english: Toro Rosso brought a modified exit for their exhaust to China.
sentences.chinese: 紅牛二隊帶來了一種改進的出口爲他們的排氣到中國。

sentences.english: I think that Red Bull and Toro Rosso is on the right way.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲紅牛車隊和紅牛之隊位於正確的道路上。

sentences.english: I think that Red Bull and Toro Rosso is on the right way.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲紅牛車隊和紅牛之隊位於正確的道路上。

definition: to make a comeback/(of a doctor's assessment of the gender of a fetus) to turn out to be wrong
to be out of form/not to be oneself
to deal the fatal blow (sports, chess etc)/to score the winning point
to have a competition/to measure with one's hand or arm/to make a gesture of measuring
to not go home until drunk (idiom)/let's make a night of it!
